thread.title: Alabama to honor Ken Stabler before LSU game
thread.title_full: Alabama to honor Ken Stabler before LSU game

title: Alabama to honor Ken Stabler before LSU game
text:
Alabama to honor Ken Stabler before LSU game Tools By Alabama News Network 
Story Created: Oct 22, 2015 at 6:47 PM CDT 
TUSACLOOSA, Ala.- The Alabama football team will honor the late Ken Stabler prior to kickoff Nov. 7 against LSU. 
Stablerâ€™s family will be on the field before the game while a video tribute is played. A story in the game program will also be provided. 
Stabler passed away in June due to colon cancer at the age of 69. He played for Alabama from 1964-1967 and led the Crimson Tide to an 11-0 record in 1966. 
Stabler spent 15 seasons in the NFL, most of them with the Oakland Raiders, leading them to a win in Super Bowl XI.
